name: RISE Weekend Dallas - July 18-20, 2019
description:
RISE Weekend is happening in Dallas, TX from July 18th-20th, 2019! RISE Weekend is a multi-day personal growth conference created and led by Rachel Hollis. RISE Weekend is an event where women from every walk of life can come together to be inspired, supported and enveloped in a community.

Expect to be energized and motivated. Expect to cry and make new friends. Expect to reconnect with those dreams and goals you’ve been carrying around for years, without any idea of what to do with them. Expect to be inspired to RISE!

Thursday, July 18th - 9am - 4pm - Add onto your RISE Weekend experience by purchasing the extra, and optional Health & Wellness Day. This day is all about owning your PRESENT. How are the choices you are making RIGHT NOW with your mental + physical health helping or hurting you develop into a better version of you? Health & Wellness Day tickets are sold separately.

Friday, July 19th - 10am - 5pm - The first day of RISE Weekend will be all about owning your PAST. You can’t get to the next step in your life without acknowledging where you’ve come from.

Saturday, July 20th - 10am - 5pm - The next day is about owning your FUTURE. Now that you know what you’ve walked through, learn how that can make you a warrior for who you are about to become.

We love to end our events with an epic Dance Party and our favorite DJ! Please note - Dance Party tickets are sold separately and must be purchased with either a RISE Weekend or Health & Wellness Day ticket.

For a list of our event FAQs, check them out HERE.

name: Plano Brunch Festival & Race to Brunch 5k
description:
Join us for BRUNCH! The festivities for the Plano Brunch Festival are kicking off at 8am with the RACE TO BRUNCH 5K Presented by O'Neil Wysocki Family Law!


The Race to Brunch 5k will start at The District at the Shops at Willow Bend! The course will take you through the perimeters at The Shops at Willow Bend and you'll end at the finish line with a mimosa toast and brunch treats!


The 5k registration fee is only $30 and includes a chip timed course, a Race to Brunch T-shirt, a sweet finishers medal, a Race to Brunch swag bag, a brunch snack provided by Kelly's Craft Tavern and thanks to our finish line partners Breadwinners Cafe, you'll get a delicious upside down pineapple mimosa as you cross the finish line! A portion of the event proceeds benefits our non-profit partner: Lovepacs!


The Brunch Fest will kick off at 9am and will feature brunch cuisine from a variety of delicious restaurants, brunch cocktails, lots of artisans and boutiques, culinary demonstrations lead by Plano chefs and culinary experts, live music by the Moving Colors Band, a brunch photo-booth and lots more!


GET YOUR BRUNCH PASS NOW! The Brunch pass includes 3 drink tickets to use at any of the brunch bars and food tickets to 7 restaurants so you can enjoy brunch cuisne from all 7 restaurants!

WWW.THEBRUNCHFEST.COM


We're booking all event partners now! Sponsors, restaurants, chefs, vendors, boutiques, bands, etc! Email us for info: hello@sbghospitality.com!


Thank you to our official media partner: Plano Magazine!

Be sure to check out the Plano Beer Walk hosted by Plano Magazine!

Follow the Plano Brunch Fest & Race to Brunch 5k on facebook HERE.


PACKET PICK UP:

WEDNESDAY APRIL 24TH, 4PM-7PM, ACADEMY SPORTS + OUTDOORS, 3305 DALLAS PARKWAY, PLANO,TX 75093
refundPolicy: If you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase, you can return the event tickets and get a full refund or exchange the tickets for another event, be it similar or not. You can return the tickets for up to 30 days from the date you purchased it.

name: Dallas Cowboys Draft Day 5K
description:
The Dallas Cowboys Draft Day 5K returns to the The Star in Frisco on Saturday, April 27th. Run or walk a 5K in Cowboys gear and enjoy family-friendly Draft Day activities. It's the perfect race for Cowboys fans of all ages! Will you be there?

New in 2019!

  • Kids Run: Get the little ones excited early and sign them up to join the Kids Run. Ages 14 and under.
  • Virtual Run: Can't make it to Frisco on April 27th? Don't fret - for those fans that still want to show their support of the Dallas Cowboys from out of town. Register and receive all race perks - simply run from afar!

PARTICIPANT PERKS

  • Start at The Star in Frisco
  • Receive an official shirt and a commemorative finisher’s medal
  • Enjoy post-race Draft Day activities at The Star


For details on all of the 2019 Draft Events, visit https://www.dallascowboys.com/fans/draft-day-5k/2019/.


EVENT SCHEDULE

Thursday, April 25th

  • 4:00pm - 8:00pm - Packet Pick-Up @ Fans United, Ford Center at The Star

Friday, April 26th

  • 4:00pm - 8:00pm - Packet Pick-Up @ Fans United, Ford Center at The Star

RACE DAY - Saturday, April 27th

  • 9:00am - Draft Day 5K
  • 10:00am - Draft Day Activities at The Star
  • 10:00am - Awards
  • 10:30am - Kids Run

name: Boston Beer and Cheese Fest
description:
Boston Beer and Cheese Fest is back for it's fifth year! Join us March 29th and 30th to sample local craft beer, cider, cheese and charcuterie. The fest will feature:

  • 25 NorthEast breweries
  • 12 cheese makers
  • Charcuterie and specialty food vendors
  • 25 beer/cider & cheese pairings

Your ticket includes unlimited sampling of beer, cheese and charcuterie.

If you’re in the know, you realize that beer and cheese go together in ways most people wouldn’t believe…if you DON’T think that beer and cheese are a magical pairing, then the Boston Beer & Cheese Fest 2019 will be a wake-up call that you can’t miss! Last year sold out over two months in advance, so get your tickets early.

SIGN UP FOR OUR EMAIL LIST HERE TO FIND OUT AS SOON AS THEY'RE AVAILABLE.

TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 16TH AT 10AM EST

Please Note:

  • There are no refunds OR exchanges.
  • All attendees must be 21+ with a valid ID. Nobody will be allowed into the building who is under 21 or who doesn't have a valid ID, this includes toddlers and infants.
  • Tickets will be emailed by Eventbrite. You must bring this ticket to the event where it will be scanned.
  • You can transfer tickets using Eventbrite.
  • We give no entry guarantee if you buy your ticket from a reseller.

Boston Beer & Cheese Fest 2019

March 29th & 30th

The Cyclorama - 539 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

Session 1 - Friday, March 29th: 6-9:30pm 

Session 2 - Saturday, March 30th: 1-4:30pm

Session 3 - Saturday, March 30th: 6-9:30pm

Why Join Us At Boston Beer & Cheese Fest?

It’s craft beer, cider and cheese…what more do you need to know?! If you do need more info, though, Boston Beer & Cheese Fest focuses on NorthEast-made craft beers, ciders and cheeses. By attending you’ll have access to over 80 craft beers and ciders from 25 local brewers/cideries, as well as tons of cheese from 12 local creameries. If that’s not enough, we’ll be pairing a beer/cider from each brewer with a cheese from each creamery…that’s 25 beer/cider and cheese pairings! Oh yeah, and charcuterie! If that doesn’t make your mouth water, we don’t know what else to say.

How Much Does It Cost?

For only $60 you’ll get admittance to one session which includes:

  • Unlimited 2oz samples of 80+ NorthEast craft beers & ciders from 25 breweries/cideries
  • Unlimited samples of cheese from 12 NorthEast creameries
  • Charcuterie samples
  • Biodegradable tasting cup
  • Fest Guide

Which Breweries Are Coming?

We'll have 25 NorthEast brewers and cider makers in attendance bringing 80+ beers and ciders. Some of our brewers include the following (NOTE: This is only a partial list. We'll continue to announce more of the brewers and beers in the coming weeks; Brewers and beers are subject to change and availability; All pours are 2oz or less per MA State Law):

  • Abandoned Building Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Aeronaut Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Allagash Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Amherst Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Artifact Cider (MA)
  • Barrier Brewing Co. (NY)
  • Battery Steele Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Baxter Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Brewery Ommegang (NY)
  • Cambridge Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Definitive Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Essex County Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Exhibit 'A' Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Far From the Tree Cider (MA)
  • Idle Hands Craft Ales (MA)
  • Lone Pine Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Redemption Rock Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Rising Tide Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Riverwalk Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Shacksbury Cider (VT)
  • SingleCut Beersmiths (NY)
  • Springdale Barrel Room (MA)
  • Stormalong Cider (MA)
  • Trillium Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Vanished Valley Brewing Co. (MA)

What Creameries Will be Joining?

We’re working with local cheese experts to get a great, diverse selection of local cheeses that will pair excellently with beer and cider. Some of our creameries include the following (NOTE: This is only a partial list. We'll have 12 creameries/affineurs in total. Creameries/cheeses are subject to change and availability):

  • Bell & Goose Cheese Co. (South Hampton, NH)
  • Consider Bardwell Farm (West Pawlet, VT)
  • Cricket Creek Farm (Williamstown, MA)
  • Crown Finish Caves (Brooklyn, NY)
  • Grafton Village Cheese (Grafton, VT)
  • The Grey Barn & Farm (Chilmark, MA)
  • Mozzarella House (Peabody, MA)
  • Narragansett Creamery (Providence, RI)
  • Parish Hill Creamery (Putney, VT)
  • Spring Brook Farm (Reading, VT)
  • Vermont Creamery (Websterville, VT)
  • West River Creamery (VT)

Charcuterie? What Charcuterie?!

Last year's addition of charcuterie was so popular, we're bringing it back! We'll have (subject to change and availability):

  • New England Charcuterie (Waltham, MA)
  • Short Creek Farm (Northwood, NH)

Food

While we'd all like to, we sadly cannot survive on cheese and beer alone. So, with that in mind, we've got a couple great food vendors as well:

  • Shuck Truck
  • Burgundian Waffles

name: FUNK Boston: A Wild & Sour Beer Fest
description:
FUNK Boston: A Wild & Sour Beer Fest will feature upwards of 35 brewers pouring over 125 beers ranging from American ales introduced to wild yeast strains like Brettanomyces to expressions of traditional European styles such as Lambic or Gueuze. Hosted by BeerAdvocate, presented by Dogfish Head, and held at the Cyclorama in Boston on June 14 & 15, 2019, the festival will span two days and three sessions. Limited to 700 tickets per session.

For more info: https://www.beeradvocate.com/funk/

Disclaimers:

  • All attendees must be 21+ with a valid ID.
  • All sales are final. No refunds, session switching, or exceptions.
  • All beers are subject to change and availability.
  • Tickets include all beer samples, a tasting cup, and a printed fest guide while supplies last. Food sold separately.
  • Pours are 2-ounces (or less). Please consume with respect.
  • Pace yourself, and find out what the ABV of a beer is before you consume. Drink for flavor, not just for impact.
  • Please be advised that some of the beers poured at the fest may contain allergens. Ask before you drink.
  • By purchasing fest tickets, or attending the fest, all attendees agree to any and all rules, restrictions, and forfeit any claims of liability as outlined here and on any and all fest related materials. Please read our Help page and all other fest info before purchasing tickets.
refundPolicy: No Refunds. All sales are final.

name: Chicago Donut Fest - A River North Donut Tasting!
description:
Taste some of the best donuts in Chicago as we celebrate our love for these delicious, sugary treats!

Tickets include donut tastings from some of Chicago's most famous donut shops & bakeries as well as some hidden gems you may not have heard of! Tickets also include 3 drink tickets valid for beer or mimosas!

Want to have your donut featured at Chicago Donut Fest? E-mail us at Info@ChicagoDonutFest.com now to find out how to sample at any of our upcoming events!

FREE TICKETS/RAISE MONEY FOR YOUR CAUSE: See below for more info.

FREE STUFF!

All attendees will also receive the following Freebies*: 2 FREE rides from Via using promo code 'CTS2' – Get $10 in DoorDash cash from DoorDash – $10 in FREE food at your favorite restaurants like Freshii, Protein Bar, Rockit & more from Ritual! *All offers valid for first time users only and subject to change without notice. Click HERE for more info!

PHOTO CONTEST:

Enter to win our PHOTO CONTEST by posting pictures to Facebook or Instagram using "#ChicagoDonutFest" Our panel of judges will go through the pictures and winners will be contacted after the event!

PICS FROM LAST TIME: Check out pictures from our last donut fest by clicking HERE!

Rules, Regulations & Disclaimers:

All guests must be 21+ with a valid government issued ID that will be checked by security prior to entrance. Brands subject to change. Tickets include tastings. Enjoy responsibly. We reserve the right to curtail service to anyone if intoxicated. Please be aware that this event will comply with the Illinois Liquor Control Act 235 ILCS 5/6-16(a) A valid ticket with scannable QR code is required by all guests to enter event. It is recommended to print a paper ticket to prevent any technology complications which would prevent your ticket from displaying on your phone. There is no guest list. Each ticket must be scanned. Security reserves the right to inspect all bags and persons. Absolutely no outside food or beverage may be brought into the event. Guests who are deemed intoxicated (or otherwise unfit), will be denied entry and no refunds will be given. We want all guests to enjoy themselves, but our number one priority is the safety of all guests. Any ticketing/technical issues will be handled by Eventbrite.com. Please contact them directly at https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/. Sorry – no refunds or price adjustments. The Eventbrite system does not allow us to restrict people who are underage from buying tickets. If you are not 21 and purchase a ticket, you will not be allowed into the event. For further Terms and Conditions of this event and ticket purchase please see “Ticket Purchase and Event Terms and Conditions” in checkout before purchasing these tickets; which shall also be binding and shall be incorporated by reference as though fully stated herein.

name: 2019 LA Beer Fest
description:
The 11th annual LA Beer Festival follows last year's sold out event, and this year's promises to be even better. The event will feature dozens of international and domestic beers, over a dozen food trucks (food sold separately) as well as live entertainment.

The 2019 LA Beer Festival will take place at LA Center Studios Studios from noon to 3pm and 5pm to 8pm. Admission is for only one session so make sure to coordinate with friends before buying your ticket. You GA tickets include unlimited beer tastings with food sold separately. Connoisseur's Ticket ($85) are limited and offer attendees exclusive air conditioned bathrooms, taco bar, an indoor/outdoor event deck overlooking the event featuring limited beers/one-offs not available to general admission.

For more information, visit www.labeerfest.la

The LA Beer Festival's proceeds will benefit Noah's B-ark, Inc (tax ID 95-4677862) whose aim is to rescue dogs from shelters and find permanent homes for rescued pets. Proceeds from the event will towards funding food, shelter, and veterinary bills for rescued pets.

****************************

Before you buy your ticket, make sure you're buying tickets to the right session. Tickets can NOT be exchanged for another session 3/30/18. Tickets are non refundable. Event is strictly 21 and over. No exceptions. Event is RAIN OR SHINE! 

***************************

name: Cherry Blossom Festival
description:
Join Four Freedoms State Park in celebrating the Roosevelt Island Community Cherry Blossom Festival featuring Traditional and Modern Japanese Performances and Cultural Fair, and special performances at the Park!

Schedule of Events:

11:00am

  • Tea Ceremony, Southpoint Park
  • Community Picnics & Food Vendors, West Promenade (across from Cornell Tech)

11:00am - 2:00pm

  • Japanese Cultural Fair, Gallery RIVAA

12:30pm - 5:00pm

  • Music and Dance Performances, Four Freedoms State Park

Please note: Registration for this event is not required. By registering for this event, you’re helping organizers estimate audience size and ensure the safety and security of all attendees. Because of capacity limits, registration does not guarantee access to all event areas.

location.address1: Crissy Field across from the Sports Basement

name: 2019 Levi's Presidio 10 Presented by The Guardsmen
description:
The Levi's Presidio 10 is a fun, family-oriented race in the Presidio of San Francisco. Runners can run either a 10 mile, 10 kilometer, or a 5 kilometer scenic course starting and finishing at Crissy field. The 10 mile and 10K run courses go over and back on the Golden Gate Bridge. Entertainment at the finish line with post race expo that includes awards for age divisions, hot breakfast, party tents from multiple sponsors, and live music.

Race-Day Schedule of Events

6:00 AM Registration Opens

7:52 Warm-ups/Stretching for 10 Mile

8:00 Start 10 Mile Race 

8:22 Warm-ups/Stretching for 10 Kilometer Race 

8:30 Start 10 Kilometer Race 

8:45 Music & Festivities Begin! 

9:00 Start 5 Kilometer Race 

10:00 10K Awards Ceremony 

10:30 10 Mile Awards Ceremony

FAQs

Who are The Guardsmen? Why is this a benefit?

Every year The Guardsmen changes lives across the Bay Area by sending more than 2,500 at-risk youth to outdoor education programs and by providing scholarships for more than 250 students to attend private schools. Learn more about The Guardsmen

Can I help fundraise?

The Levi's Presidio 10 is an all volunteer race and 100% of the proceeds are donated back to the community. For 34 years Presidio 10 runners have been sending underprivileged youth to summer camp. When you sign up for the race please consider also joining our Crowdrise fundraising team where if you raise $100 not only do you send a kid to camp but you'll also earn a sweet tech tee as a thank you! Check out our site to learn more. It only takes 3 minutes to register for a fundraising page at https://presidio10.guardsmen.org/. Just click "Fundraise for kids" at the top of the page and begin making an even greater impact on at-risk youth.

Where are the course maps?

Course maps for the races can be found by clicking on the "Race Info" tab on the P10 home page.

How do I get there and where do I park?

Please park in the East Beach Parking Lot, or the Marina Green Parking Lot and walk to the Start and Finish area. We encourage you to take public transit if possible. Due to construction, the area between McDowell Avenue and Girard Road will be closed. The Sports Basement parking lot will be closed to participants on the day of the event.

name: Wynwood Pride 2019 - LGBTQIA+ Music Festival & PRIDE Block Party
description:
The Inaugural Wynwood Pride is THE place to be PRIDEFUL in Miami this upcoming June (National LGBTQ Pride Month) The local community will celebrate the full spectrum of diversity in the center of Miami’s Wynwood Arts District, benefiting three of our nonprofit partners in the fields of YOUTH, HEALTH, and JUSTICE. 


The weekend’s festivities will include a 3 DAY live concert series, drag shows with local and international icons, lips synching battles, late-night DJs, non-profit community village, family-oriented programming, art & lifestyle vendors, cocktails, an immersive food hall and more.

Register for your Free Drink with RSVP!

SCHEDULE

Friday 4pm - 3am / Saturday 12pm - 3am / Sunday 12pm - 10pm

TALENT

We are always looking for talent that can give an entertaining performance. If you are interested in performing at this year's event, apply today! https://www.wynwoodpride.com/talent/

SPONSORS

Wynwood Pride is a perfect location for brand activation. You bring the brand, and we’ll bring you thousands of visitors in the heart of Miami's coolest neighborhood, the Wynwood Art District. Apply here: https://www.wynwoodpride.com/sponsor/


https://www.wynwoodpride.com/

name: Atlanta Balloon Glow
description:
The first ever Atlanta Balloon Glow takes place 1 to 4 August 2019 in Piedmont Park.

About this Event

Hot air balloons will glow each evening with tethered balloon rides also available. The event also features the best food vendors, retail vendors and activities for the little ones!

General Admission is FREE!! Balloon activity will be located in The Meadow - which is the South East area of the park close to The Park Tavern.

Tethered rides booked in advance are just $20 per person.

out our balloon rides for couples, where you will have your very own hot air balloon for a few minutes of alone time with your sweetie while taking in the Atlanta Skyline.

Our VIP tickets give you access to a special VIP seating area including climate controlled bathrooms. On arrival you will receive a champagne toast and a ticket to experience a tethered balloon ride plus seating with a great view of the main glow which takes place at 7pm.

All guests experiencing balloon rides must first sign in at our waiver desk to sign our insurance waiver. Here you will be given a token to hand to your balloon pilot when you ride. Without a token, you will be unable to ride. All pre-booked guests must check in by 7:30pm each evening.

Terms and Conditions

*Event is rain or shine.

*Balloon activity is subject to suitable weather conditions. Should balloon activity be postponed, tickets will be valid at future Midflo events and / or rain out dates to be held if and as required.

*Tickets purchased through Eventbrite are strictly non refundable.

*Tethered rides will begin as close to 5pm as the weather conditions permit and will operate until 9pm or until weather conditions dictate. We advise guests to arrive in good time and to please be patient. Sometimes balloon activity can be delayed or curtailed by the weather - please keep an eye on our Facebook page for updates on weather conditions and event information.

*The main balloon glow consists of around ten balloons and will begin around 7pm subject to suitable weather conditions. The main glow will last around one hour.

*There is no car parking available at Piedmont Park during the event and we ask that all guests travel by Public Transport and / or MARTA. There is a significant parking permit scheme for residents in the local neighborhood, and Midflo or the Atlanta Balloon Glow cannot accept any responsibility for cars that may be ticketed or towed.

*Picnic blankets and camping chairs are permitted but no coolers please.

*The Atlanta Balloon Glow is a smoke free environment - please consider others and exit the park if you need to smoke. Thanks for your kindness!

location.address1: The Mann Center for the Performing Arts

name: Comcast NBC Universal Memorial Salute at The Mann
description:
COMCAST NBCUNIVERSAL MEMORIAL SALUTE

Todd Ellison, Conductor

Mann Center for the Performing Arts


FEATURING

Todd Ellison, conductor

Justin Hopkins, vocalist

Voices of the POPS

The Philly POPS Festival Chorus


The Philly POPS presents the fourth annual Comcast NBCUniversal Memorial Salute at the Mann, a community concert honoring the American tradition of service on Saturday, May 25 over Memorial Day weekend.


In celebration of those who serve, all tickets to the concert will be provided FREE of charge starting on 2/14/19. Particular blocks of seats will be provided for veterans, active military, Philadelphia police officers, and firefighters – plus local students and Boy and Girl Scouts.


Led by Maestro Todd Ellison, Memorial Salute features the 65-piece POPS orchestra, internationally-recognized Philly-native Justin Hopkins, The Philly POPS Festival Chorus, The Voices of the POPS, and local student choirs in a stirring line-up of patriotic anthems, Great American Songbook classics, and showtunes.


TICKETS:

To request your free tickets to this concert simply REGISTER above and you will receive a ticket voucher as confirmation. Please bring a printed copy of this voucher with you to the Mann Center day of event. Tickets will be available on a first-come, first-served basis within the Main, Terrace and Lawn sections. (general admission).

For groups of 20 or more call 215.253.6980 or e-mail groups@phillypops.org.


Comcast NBCUniversal is the Presenting Sponsor of The Philly POPS Salute Series. These free celebrations of community and tradition, which honor our shared commitment to service on holidays of American tradition, also rely on the generous support of Major Sponsors Bank of America, Archer Law, and Drs. John* and Pina Templeton as well as grants through partnership with the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and the City of Philadelphia.
